p: From our survey, 29 plant species from 28 genera belonging to 24 botanical families claimed as anticancer plants in Uganda have been reported ( Table 1). The most cited families were Bignoniaceae (7%), Caricaceae (7%), Fabaceae (7%), Moraceae (7%), and Rutaceae (7%). Most families encountered in this study have reported use in the traditional management of cancer in other countries across the globe. For example, Apocynaceae, Asteraceae, Bignoniaceae, Caricaceae, Fabaceae, Malvaceae, Meliaceae, Moraceae, Rutaceae, Sapindaceae, and Solanaceae were cited in Kenya [ 170], Ethiopia [ 238], Tanzania [ 97], and Near East (Arabian Peninsula, Egypt, Iraq, Iran, Israel, Jordan, Lebanon, Palestinian territories, Syria, and Turkey) [ 239], Lamiaceae in Morocco [ 240], and Apocynaceae, Meliaceae, and Malvaceae in Sri Lanka [ 241].
